metadata.title: CVE-2021-46671 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
options.c in atftp before 0.7.5 reads past the end of an array, and consequently discloses server-side /etc/group data to a remote client.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46671` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

atftp - 0.7.git20210915-2
atftpd - 0.7.git20210915-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: atftp package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.7.git20210915-2').
